schedule.show_name: Animals use unique weapons that help them survive in the wild, from camouflaging cuttlefish and hidden hippos to ferocious great white sharks and venomous spiders and snakes.
On Botswana's Linyanti Plains, three cheetah brothers, Achilles, Odin and Shiva fiercely guard their territory. But when Achilles unexpectedly dies, the others must learn to defend against invaders.
For animal parents in the wild, the stakes could not be higher, with success ensuring the future of life on our incredible planet.
The filmmaker explores the importance of the marula in Sub-Saharan Africa's ecosystem, providing sustenance and sanctuary for local animals.
During the dry season in Ruaha state,a herd of elephants visit the water body at Glade to extract the cleanest water using their trunk.
The filmmaker follows the journey of two female cheetahs in the Serengeti as they struggle to raise their young cubs and protect their families from predators and starvation.
The seven teenage lions of Nsefu are training to become hunters. However, this has resulted in some misconduct, in contrast to their otherwise seemingly flawless group.
Life in the Limpopo River basin is a fight for survival. During the dry season, with wildlife awaiting the flood waters, disaster grips the valley when the rains are late.
Baffin Island in the Canadian Arctic archipelago is a place of extremes. When winter begins, a relentless fight for survival ensues for the local wildlife.
The filmmaker captures the intimate lives of four female tigers and their cubs in Tadoba, India, over seven years, offering a rare look at their behaviors in their natural habitat.
From finding scarce water beneath desert ground to crossing thousands of miles in the skies, these amazing animals have created unique tools and techniques to cope with the harshest challenges.
The Serengeti and its dangerous forests are home to a mother leopardess who is both a caring provider and a fearless defender of her family.
When a male leopard stumbles upon the scene of another leopard making a kill, instead of chasing off the other predator and potentially losing the prey, he leaps in to assist.
The filmmaker captures the unique natural wonders, vibrant landscapes and extraordinary wildlife of different countries that contribute to the beauty of the Earth's ecosystem.
The filmmaker sheds light on the turbulent lives of hippopotamuses where they fight for dominance with each other while maintaining a symbiotic relationship with crocodiles.
When a male leopard stumbles upon the scene of another leopard making a kill, instead of chasing off the other predator and potentially losing the prey, he leaps in to assist.
The filmmaker captures the unique natural wonders, vibrant landscapes and extraordinary wildlife of different countries that contribute to the beauty of the Earth's ecosystem.
The seven teenage lions of Nsefu are training to become hunters. However, this has resulted in some misconduct, in contrast to their otherwise seemingly flawless group.
Explore remarkable aquatic life, including birds and the diverse species that have developed symbiotic relationships to survive challenging river and ocean environments.
The filmmaker explores the lives of Asian elephants in the jungles of Northeast India, highlighting conservation efforts to ensure a harmonious future for both humans and wildlife.
A nasty cub attempts to mate with members of the pride, for which it is asked to leave the group by an authoritative adult through the use of violence.
South Africa's Drakensberg is home to sharp climatic and ecological gradients as physical conditions change for both land-based creatures and the raptors that swirl in the skies above.
The filmmaker sheds light on how two young male dogs desire to overthrow Old John, the king dog, residing in the Great Plains of North America.
The filmmaker captures the intimate lives of four female tigers and their cubs in Tadoba, India, over seven years, offering a rare look at their behaviors in their natural habitat.
The filmmaker traces the journey of a lioness, striving to overcome the challenges of the wildlife ecosystem, along with protecting her cubs from danger.
One of the Nsefu's newborn cubs stands out from the rest due to its smaller size. While its survival chances are not great, its shy personality keeps it protected when it is away from its clan.
Life in the Limpopo River basin is a fight for survival. During the dry season, with wildlife awaiting the flood waters, disaster grips the valley when the rains are late.
The African rock python's aggression, its gruesome man-eating tendencies and its unique constriction skills make it one of the most feared predators of the continent.
The filmmaker sheds light on the behaviour and physical features of major African predators and the strategies that they use to kill their prey and defend themselves.
One of the Nsefu's newborn cubs stands out from the rest due to its smaller size. While its survival chances are not great, its shy personality keeps it protected when it is away from its clan.
